channel.title: The complete list of tech terms starting with the letter 'B' on Tech Terminologies
channel.description: Recent content in The complete list of tech terms starting with the letter 'B' on Tech Terminologies

item.title: What is a Bitmap?
item.description: A bitmap is a type of digital image file that represents a grid of pixels as a collection of bits.

item.title: What is a Batch File?
item.description: A batch file is a text file that contains a series of commands that are executed by the command-line interpreter on the operating system.

item.title: What is a Build?
item.description: A build (also known as a “build process”) is the process of transforming source code into a stand-alone, executable form that can be run on a computer or other device.

item.title: What is a Browser Extension?
item.description: A browser extension is a small software program that adds additional functionality to a web browser.

item.title: What is a Base Station?
item.description: A base station is a device that serves as a central hub for wireless communication in a local area network (LAN).

item.title: What is Barebones?
item.description: A barebones PC is a computer that comes with only the essential components, such as a motherboard, processor, and power supply.

item.title: What is Bare Metal?
item.description: A bare metal system is a computer that does not include an operating system or any other software, so the user must install an operating system in order to use the hardware.

item.title: What is BSB (Backside Bus)?
item.description: The backside bus (BSB) is a bus that connects the CPU to the level 2 (L2) cache on a computer.
